docs.title: History of Processing
docs.text: Processing is a free, open-source coding language for visual art developed by Ben Fry and Casey Reas, former classmates at the MIT Media Lab. Launched in 2001 as Proce55ing, the project encompasses a programming environment designed for artists’ use, and a community of practitioners.

docs.title: String Harmonics
docs.text:
Contributed by Shawn McBurnie

  • String Harmonics Demo No Sound
  • String Harmonics Demo With Sound (not working)

docs.title: Sample Prompt
docs.text:
Create a single file p5.js sketch on a canvas of width=800 and height=200.
Generate a demonstration of string harmonics.
Allow the string to vary from a frequency of 1 to 16.
Add a slider that changes the frequency with a step of .1
